reviewText: This is a sweet and family friendly film. Really enjoyed it.
Wasn't too bad young grandchildren liked it, but older ones said not so good

My husband and I really enjoyed this movie and especially enjoyed the great performance of the young star, Alexis Rosinsky.  She did an outstanding job carrying the movie (at the ripe old age if 12).  We have 12 grandchildren and are planning to send the DVD to all of them but the oldest, an 18 year old young man.  I highly recommend this film to young people, especially pre-teenage and teenage girls, it's fun and wonderfully wholesome! It's very much like the family movies we grew up with in the '50's and early 60's.

This is just another example of a cheesy independently made movie that received a high rating, probably by the movie's producer or his best friend, in order to influence it's purchase. It is a poorly made film with two dimensional acting, hackneyed plot, fake accents, and a ridiculous ending. I am really unhappy I wasted money on this film for my granddaughter who intelligence was insulted.
A horse is a horse, of course of course; and no one can talk to a talking horse, unless of course that talking horse is the famous Mr. Ed .Nice take off of an old tv series.
A must watch for families. My daughter and I are horse owners and lovers so this was definitely our kind of Friday night popcorn movie
The best part of the film is the dance party, but the film overall is mediocre.  Also, why does the cover art have an actress and a brown horse who don't appear in the film???
Bad story, bad acting, fell asleep.
Not like your typical movies of today . Was very slow moving and my 7 year old got a little bored during some parts. Good story line . Overall was ok. Arrived on time
Dull, boring, nothing bad in it. Just cheesy and slow.
This is a so-so movie. Did not like it that much. Babyish!
Very enjoyable, and VERY family friendly movie!
